examples: Art is very much a matter of taste.
He takes bends much too fast.
Too much garlic killed the taste of the meat.
The meeting won't take too much time.
Thank you so much for asking me.
words.defineEn: used to refer to a large degree or amount of a thing
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ một mức độ lớn hoặc số lượng của một điều

examples: The revolution brought many changes.
Many shops have raised their prices.
Many businesses use the Salesforce platform for customer relationship management.
Many companies saw the advent of online retailing as a threat to their bricks and mortar business.
Many people decorate their homes with lights and ornaments in December for the holiday season.
words.defineEn: a large number of; a great number of
words.defineVi: một số lượng lớn; một số lượng lớn

examples: Most families have one or two skeletons in the closet.
Most students are close to the breadline.
Men still hold most positions of power in this country.
Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: having the greatest amount, quantity, or degree
words.defineVi: có số lượng, số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn nhất

examples: John will follow the path of least resistance.
A CEO may receive helpful suggestions from the least experienced employee, as even a mouse may help a lion.
They would rather take the line of least resistance than become involved in arguments.
The success of a business is only as great as the least successful department within it, as a chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
He carefully selected the least overripe avocados from the pile.
words.defineEn: smallest in amount or number
words.defineVi: nhỏ nhất về số lượng hoặc số

examples: Grasp all, lose all.
After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: every number, part, amount of something or a particular group
words.defineVi: mỗi số, một phần, số lượng của một cái gì đó hoặc một nhóm cụ thể

examples: In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
The coach always keeps a few tricks up his sleeve.
His management style ruffled a few feathers.
After a successful career at the Italian central bank, few people doubt his ability to whip the economy into shape.
words.defineEn: a small unspecified number of people or things
words.defineVi: một số lượng nhỏ người hoặc vật không xác định

examples: My dad doesn't play golf any more.
Violence in the last analysis produces more violence.
Teachers should read more poetry to children.
The TV quiz was more fun than a barrel of monkeys!
To my way of thinking, this approach is more efficient.
words.defineEn: used to refer to a number, amount, or degree that is bigger or larger
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ một số lượng, số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn hơn hoặc lớn hơn

examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
The whole is sometime less than the sum of its parts.
I could care less about award shows.
Guys automatically become less attractive when they break Priscian's head.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
words.defineEn: a smaller amount or number of; not as much
words.defineVi: một số lượng nhỏ hơn hoặc số lượng; không nhiều bằng

examples: These reforms will produce little change.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Surprisingly, the little café had the best coffee in town.
The little café had, surprisingly, the best coffee in town.
These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
words.defineEn: a small amount of; small in quantity or degree; not much or almost none
words.defineVi: một lượng nhỏ; nhỏ về số lượng hoặc mức độ; không nhiều hoặc hầu như không có

examples: These reforms will produce little change.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Surprisingly, the little café had the best coffee in town.
The little café had, surprisingly, the best coffee in town.
These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
words.defineEn: to a small extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ nhỏ hoặc mức độ

examples: The cruise went very quickly.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
Her condition is very serious.
The design is very basic.
words.defineEn: to a great extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc mức độ

examples: My dad doesn't play golf any more.
Violence in the last analysis produces more violence.
Teachers should read more poetry to children.
The TV quiz was more fun than a barrel of monkeys!
To my way of thinking, this approach is more efficient.
words.defineEn: used for forming the comparative of many adverbs and adjectives
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hình thành so sánh của nhiều trạng từ và tính từ

examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
The whole is sometime less than the sum of its parts.
I could care less about award shows.
Guys automatically become less attractive when they break Priscian's head.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
words.defineEn: not so much; to a smaller degree or extent
words.defineVi: không nhiều lắm; đến một mức độ nhỏ hơn hoặc mức độ

examples: The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
My father is quite old now
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
He plays quite well.
words.defineEn: to the highest degree
words.defineVi: ở mức độ cao nhất

examples: My people have a horse in this race, too.
An ostrich strategy for covid-19 is too risky.
Your explanation is too complicated!
That investment is too risky.
He takes bends much too fast.
words.defineEn: more than enough; to an extent that is not necessary
words.defineVi: quá đủ; đến mức không cần thiết

examples: My knowledge of French is pretty basic.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
The board meeting painted a pretty grim picture.
Those movie stars live pretty high off the hog.
Years of war have left their mark on these pretty islands.
words.defineEn: to a degree that is high but not very high
words.defineVi: ở mức độ cao nhưng không cao lắm

examples: The news really made my day.
That bacon sandwich really hit the spot!
The contractor is really taking their time.
Your friend really talks a blue streak!
That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
words.defineEn: used to put emphasis on a statement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh vào một tuyên bố

examples: Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
She makes a point of treating her employees fairly.
Cornish homeowners wonder if they are being fairly served
I don’t think I was fairly treated, but then that’s life, isn’t it?

In a business, when employers treat their employees fairly and provide opportunities for growth and development, it can lead to a more motivated and dedicated workforce, as good masters make good servants.
words.defineEn: more than average, but not too much
words.defineVi: hơn mức trung bình, nhưng không quá nhiều

examples: His family comes first.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
She dived head first into the water.
The horse took the first fence well.
words.defineEn: coming or happening before any other person or thing
words.defineVi: đến hoặc xảy ra trước bất kỳ người nào khác hoặc điều

examples: Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Take the second road on the right.
Swimming is second nature to Jane.
She came second in the exam.
words.defineEn: coming or happening just after the first person or thing
words.defineVi: đến hoặc xảy ra ngay sau người đầu tiên hoặc điều

examples: She lives on the third floor of a residential building.
That piece of work just rejected my resume for the third time!
I got the third degree when I got home last night.
A third of dog owners have experienced love at first sight when setting eyes on their dog.
The pair went toe to toe until the third set, when Azarenka squandered two match points.
words.defineEn: coming or happening right after the second person or thing
words.defineVi: đến hoặc xảy ra ngay sau người thứ hai hoặc điều

examples: The explanation went completely over my head.
My mouth felt completely dry.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The millstone around my neck is choking me completely.
words.defineEn: to the greatest amount or extent possible; fully
words.defineVi: với số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn nhất có thể; đầy đủ

examples: The vibrant orange color of a ripe nectarine is so appealing.
so I ate my fill.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
So, did you get the promotion?
So who spilled the beans about her affair with David?
words.defineEn: very much or to a great amount
words.defineVi: rất nhiều hoặc đến một số lượng lớn

examples: Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
To show great courage.
The pope himself had taken great umbrage at the book.
The baby has brought them great joy.
words.defineEn: large in degree, size, or quantity
words.defineVi: lớn về mức độ, kích thước, hoặc số lượng

examples: She was extremely sick, but we were waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
We were made to feel extremely welcome.
He's extremely irritable - he flies off the handle at the slightest thing.
The Prime Minister is understood to have been extremely angry about the report.
It was a small problem and she has been treated extremely badly.
words.defineEn: to a very great amount or degree
words.defineVi: đến một số lượng rất lớn hoặc mức độ

examples: The vibrant orange color of a ripe nectarine is so appealing.
so I ate my fill.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
So, did you get the promotion?
So who spilled the beans about her affair with David?
words.defineEn: to such a great extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn như vậy hoặc mức độ

examples: The faceplate is turned rather than cast.
I killed a rather good bottle of Fleurie.
I found her story rather hard to swallow.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
The company opted for a settlement rather than taking their former employee to court.
words.defineEn: to some extent or degree
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ nào đó hoặc mức độ

examples: My mind went totally blank.
His explanation is totally full of prunes and doesn't answer the question at all.
As so often happened, Peter, Tommy and Henry had totally lost sight of their real objective.
I'm sorry I didn't call you back sooner, it totally slipped my mind.
I totally blew my cover when I stupidly wore my school jacket to steal the other team's mascot.
words.defineEn: to the full amount or degree
words.defineVi: đến toàn bộ số lượng hoặc mức độ

examples: You are unusually communicative, to the point of talking the hind legs off a donkey.
Millennials have been unusually unlucky.
But it’s unusually gentle.
Unusually, Limbaugh himself was speechless.
These words are actually unusually fun to say.
words.defineEn: more than usual or greater than average
words.defineVi: nhiều hơn bình thường hoặc lớn hơn mức trung bình

examples: Don't worry about breaking the bank either.
I know that I'm often my worst enemy, but he's not that innocent either.
All my friends were either lovey-dovey couples or wild, single girls.
A door must be either shut or open.
The first batters either missed or walked.
words.defineEn: used to introduce two choices or possibilities
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu hai lựa chọn hoặc khả năng
